cells.data:
Integers

We've done division $a \div b$, $a \mid b$, modulus

Suppose $a \equiv b \mod m, \equiv d \mod m$
Then
(i) $a + c \equiv b + d \mod m$
(ii) $ac \equiv bd \mod m$

$ab \mod m = (a \mod m)(b \mod m) \mod m$
This allows us to repeatedly apply rules

Arithmetic modulo m
$m \gt 1$
$\mathbb{Z}_m = \{ 0, 1, \dots, m-1 \}$

Define addtion $a,b \in \mathbb{Z}_m$
$a +_m b = (a + b) \mod m$
$a \times_m b = (ab) \mod m$

$0$ is the multiplicative absorption ($0 \times_m a = 0$)
And the additive identity ($0 +_m a = a$)
$1$ is the multiplicative identity

Associative, Distributive Property $\checkmark$

In other bases $b$
Some number $a$, whose digits are $a_{n-1}, \dots a_0$ in a base $b$ is equal to $\sum_0^{n-1} a_ib^i$
$0 \leq a_i \lt b$; i.e., $a_i \in \mathbb{Z}_b$
$a_{n-1} \neq 0$
$a$ is the unique representation of the number in base $b$
